args.natural_language_statement:
Let n : Nat and A be an n√ón real matrix. Suppose A is orthogonal, i.e. A·µÄ * A = I_n. Write A as a matrix of column vectors A = [A_1 | A_2 | ... | A_n] with A_i ‚àà ‚Ñù^n (the i-th column). State the conclusions: (1) For all i j : Fin n, the Euclidean dot product of the i-th and j-th columns equals Œ¥_{ij}, equivalently (A·µÄ * A) i j = if i = j then 1 else 0. (2) The set of columns {A_i | i : Fin n} is an orthonormal basis of ‚Ñù^n.

Translate this precisely into Lean4/Mathlib4 syntax (theorem statements only, no proofs). The file should begin with `import Mathlib` and each theorem must end with `:= by sorry`. Use appropriate Mathlib names for matrix transpose, multiplication and identity. Use PascalCase for types and snake_case for theorem names. Save it to the filename requested by the user.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

variable (A : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)

/-- If A is orthogonal (A·µÄ * A = I), then the (i,j)-entry of A·µÄ * A equals the Kronecker
    delta: 1 if i = j and 0 otherwise. -/
theorem columns_transpose_mul_eq_delta (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)) :
  ‚àÄ i j : n, (A.transpose * A) i j = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by sorry

/-- If A is orthogonal, then its columns form an orthonormal family in ‚Ñù^n. -/
theorem columns_form_orthonormal (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)) :
  Orthonormal ‚Ñù fun i => A.col i := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix Set Submodule

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

variable (A : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)

/-- If A is orthogonal (A·µÄ * A = I), then the (i,j)-entry of A·µÄ * A equals the Kronecker
    delta: 1 if i = j and 0 otherwise. -/
theorem columns_transpose_mul_eq_delta (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)) :
  ‚àÄ i j : n, (A.transpose * A) i j = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by sorry

/-- If A is orthogonal, then its columns form a basis of ‚Ñù^n (they are linearly independent
    and span the whole space). -/
theorem columns_form_basis (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix n n ‚Ñù)) :
  LinearIndependent ‚Ñù fun i => A.col i ‚àß Submodule.span ‚Ñù (Set.range fun i => A.col i) = ‚ä§ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Nat}
variable (A : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñù)

/-- If A is orthogonal (A·µÄ * A = I), then the dot product of the i-th and j-th columns equals
    the Kronecker delta: 1 if i = j and 0 otherwise. -/
theorem columns_dot_eq_delta (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñù)) :
  ‚àÄ i j : Fin n, dotProduct (A.col i) (A.col j) = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by sorry

/-- If A is orthogonal, then the (i,j)-entry of A·µÄ * A equals the Kronecker delta. -/
theorem columns_transpose_mul_eq_delta (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñù)) :
  ‚àÄ i j : Fin n, (A.transpose * A) i j = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by sorry

/-- If A is orthogonal, then its columns are linearly independent and span ‚Ñù^n. -/
theorem columns_form_basis (hA : A.transpose * A = (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñù)) :
  LinearIndependent ‚Ñù (fun i => A.col i) ‚àß Submodule.span ‚Ñù (Set.range fun i => A.col i) = ‚ä§ := by sorry
